qas.question: Whitehead believes any entity is in some sense what?

answers.text: nothing more and nothing less than the sum of its relations to other entities

qas.question: If an object made no difference to any other entity, what could be said about it?

answers.text: not be said to really exist.

qas.question: If relations are not secondary to what a thing is, what is it?

answers.text: they are what the thing is

qas.question: What makes up the sum of relations to an entity?
A real object forces the universe to do what?

answers.text: in some way conform to it

qas.question: How does Whitehead characterize anything that exists?

answers.text: in some sense nothing more and nothing less than the sum of its relations to other entities – its synthesis of and reaction to the world around it

qas.question: How does he describe what makes something real?

answers.text: A real thing is just that which forces the rest of the universe to in some way conform to it

qas.question: In Whitehead's thinking, what could be said about something that has no effect on any other person or object?

answers.text: if theoretically a thing made strictly no difference to any other entity (i.e. it was not related to any other entity), it could not be said to really exist

qas.question: What did Whitehead believe about the concept of relations in the context of defining an entity?

answers.text: Relations are not secondary to what a thing is, they are what the thing is.

plausible_answers.text: some sense nothing more and nothing less

qas.question: How does Whitehead not characterize anything that exists?

plausible_answers.text: A real thing is just that which forces the rest of the universe to in some way conform to it

qas.question: How does he describe what makes something fake?

plausible_answers.text: strictly no difference to any other entity

qas.question: In Whitehead's thinking, what could be said about something that has a lot of effect on any other person or object?

plausible_answers.text: Relations are not secondary to what a thing is, they are what the thing is

qas.question: What did Whitehead believe about the concept of relations in the context of not defining an entity?
